title: Ticket #2922: 64-bit guest OSes can't run in vmware for vm universe
description:
On some (and probably all) versions of VMWare, the default ethernet driver, vlance, doesn't work with 64-bit guest OSes. They require the alternate e1000 ethernet device, which can be specified in the .vmx file like so: 
ethernet0.virtualDev = "e1000"

When the vm gahp munges the .vmx file before starting starting a vmware vm, it removes all lines starting with 'ethernet' and replaces them with settings that enforce the networking options given in the job ad. This will cause 64-bit OSes to fail to start.

As a quick fix for Condor 7.7.6, the vm gahp should keep 'ethernet0.virtualDev' settings in the .vmx file. For future consideration, the vm gahp has a white-list of .vmx settings to keep and strips out all others. We should rethink this setup, as other settings that should be kept are probably being dropped.
check_ins: 2012-Apr-04 17:15   Check-in [31517]: Fix running of 64-bit OSes under VMWare for vm universe. #2922 The vm gahp was stripping out lines like 'ethernet0.virtualDev = "e1000"' from the .vmx file. This causes 64-bit OSes to fail on at least some versions of VMWare. Now, we keep these lines in the .vmx file. ===VersionHistory:Complete=== (By Jaime Frey )
